did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Records of the Virginia Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry, 2010-2013
did.origination: Virginia. Office of the Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Privacy protected information is considered closed for 75 years after date of record creation. Types of records restricted include but are not limited to: Attorney-client privilege materials and social security numbers. Restricted information has been sealed, but has not been removed from the collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Virginia Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry, 2010-2013. Accession 51126, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred on 8 January 2014 by the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry, 1111 East Broad Street, Room 4095, Richmond, Virginia, 23219.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Finally established in 2004, the eventual creation of the Agriculture and Forestry secretariat began with a 2001 gubernatorial campaign promise made by Governor Mark R. Warner to provide cabinet level representation for the agriculture and forestry industry. Further support for the creation of the secretariat came from the Governor's Agriculture Net Receipts Work Group, a task force created in 2003 by Governor Warner through the Secretary of Commerce and Trade. The goal of the task force was to determine strategies and recommendations for doubling the net profits of Virginia's agricultural sector between 2004 and 2014. Among the task force's recommendations was the creation of the, "Office of Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry to provide focus and emphasis in the development of the agriculture and forest industries." In 2004, the General Assembly of Virginia created the cabinet position of Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry with the passing of Senate Bill SB 543 and witnessed its codification through 2.2-203.3 of the Code of Virginia. Speaking at the appointment ceremony of the first Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry, Governor Warner reiterated his commitment to, "support and expand our agriculture and forestry industries" and recalled his desire to, "make sure these very important sectors of Virginia's economy received a seat at my cabinet table."

The Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry is appointed by the Governor, confirmed by the General Assembly, and serves at the Governor's pleasure. It is the secretary's responsibility to oversee several agencies and other entities that formerly reported to the Office of the Secretary of Commerce and Trade. Among the agencies reporting to the Agriculture and Forestry secretariat are the Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, the Department of Forestry, the Virginia Agricultural Council, and the Virginia Marine Products Board. The Governor may assign or reassign agencies to and from the Agriculture and Forestry secretariat through the use of executive orders. The secretary's role in leading agencies within the Agriculture and Forestry secretariat is to provide guidance and direction, "in the conservation, protection, and development of Virginia's agricultural and forest resources and in protecting the Virginia Consumer."
Governor Robert F. McDonnell appointed Todd Haymore to serve as the Virginia Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry in 2010 and he served until September 2016.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Records, 2010-2013, created and maintained by Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry, Todd Haymore, during the administration of Governor Robert F, McDonnell (2010-2014). The records include agendas, correspondence, memorandum, newspaper clippings, presentations, programs, reports, speeches, studies, and other working papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series I: Board and Commission Meetings, 2005-2013
Series III: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Assigned State Agencies, 2010-2014
Series IV: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Office of the Secretary, Events and Speeches, 2010-2013
Series V: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Office of the Secretary, Subject files, 2010-2014

did.unittitle: Series I: Board and Commission Meetings, 2005-2013.

scopecontent.p: Series I: Board and Commission Meetings, 2005-2013, is housed in 3 boxes and arranged alphabetically by folder title. This series includes agendas, correspondence, financial records, minutes, presentations, and studies from Boards and Commissions in which the Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry involved. Boards include the Chesapeake Bay Executive Council, VEDP Board, Virginia Horse Center Foundation Board, Virginia Tobacco Commission, and Virginia Wine Board, among others.

The Old Dominion Agriculture Foundation, Inc., 2010-2011.

Virginia Winery Distribution Company, Meeting, 2007 August 30.

scopecontent.p: Series II: Cabinet Meetings, 2010-2012, is housed in 2 1/2 boxes and arranged chronologically. This series contains records relating to Secretary Todd Haymore's participation in Governor Robert F. McDonnell's cabinet meetings. Records in this series include cabinet meeting schedules annotated by Secretary Haymore, weekly reports of the Office of the Secretary of Agriculture and Forestry, and notes on topics to be discussed with Commonwealth policymakers both during cabinet meetings and afterwards. Topics of particular interest in this series include international trade, Virginia wineries, and requests by Virginia localities for disaster designation due to drought conditions.

did.unittitle: Series III: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Assigned State Agencies, , 2009-2013.

scopecontent.p: Series III: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Assigned State Agencies, 2009-2013, is housed in 2 boxes and arranged alphabetically by folder title. This series contains information on the budget, House and Senate Bills, and correspondence.

Executive Amendments to the 2010-2012 Biennial Budget, 2010.
Governor's Amendments, Talking Points HOuse Version, 2013.
Series IV: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Office of the Secretary, Events and Speeches, , 2010-2013.

scopecontent.p: Series IV: Correspondence and Supporting Documentation, Office of the Secretary, Events and Speeches, 2010-2013, is housed in 5 boxes and arranged chronologically. This series includes brochures, correspondence, event briefing information, minutes, newspaper clippings, notes, presentations, press releases, and other sundry materials. Of note are copies of speeches given at the events by Secretary Todd Haymore and talking points for Governor Robert F. McDonnell.
